body: can the required meson version be reduced to accommodate lmde3
i tried to use 0.37.0, but 0.40.0 provides `link_whole`. [a link]
can you replace link_whole?, this really needs to build on lmde3

not really, no. i even waited for meson to implement this feature. that's compiler-level, it passes `-wl,--whole-archive` to the linker. it's needed to expose archive symbols in the shared libraries dynamic symbol table. by the way, meson is a really young project with really fast changes. 0.40 was an important release, you can't really *not* ship it with lmde3.
most of the meson projects will target `0.40.x`. here : * gstreamer [a link] * systemd [a link]

is there a reason you removed the existing commands and replaced them? the new commands are also duplicative and incorrect. for me, `meson build debian/build` generates errors but this is also duplicative of the command that works from step 1. this is on systems with meson version 0.61.2. also, `meson compile` and `meson install` both just run the `ninja` commands from the previous commands that were in the documentation. same for the uninstall steps that come after this. i don't understand the need to obfuscate those commands. apologies if there's any confusion on my part.
does this obsolete the `pnp_ids` meson build option and `hwdata` dependency?
can you change this instead to: [code block] or [code block] (either one should work) this would allow for multiple values to be set (such as both ctrl keys or alternate keystrokes).
